definitions.definition: The jussive mood , a verb inflection used to indicate a command, permission or agreement with a request; an instance of a verb so inflected.
A verbal mood of vague or miscellaneous senses, occurring after some particles and in conditional clauses.

main_definition: ( grammar , uncountable and countable ) The jussive mood , a verb inflection used to indicate a command, permission or agreement with a request; an instance of a verb so inflected.
secondary_definitions: ( Arabic grammar ) A verbal mood of vague or miscellaneous senses, occurring after some particles and in conditional clauses.
